page.title: 12FOOD IN NEWTON MEARNS
page.content: Mums usually go shopping twice a week to provide food for the rest of the family. When people get up in the morning, they have for their breakfast cereal or toast or egg and bacon. At school some children have school dinners which is usually some sort of meat and vegetable and then for pudding they can have sponge and custard. Other children have packed lunches which are usually sandwiches, a drink and some crisps. A few children go to their homes and their Mum can make them lunch. At 5.30 it is tea-time. Our meals are different most nights, but we have to eat them whether we like them or not. Before we go to bed we usually have drink, perhaps hot chocolate or tea. If we are hungry we can have toast but we usually have chocolate biscuits.
